Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth assumed spherical with radius specified (in m) by data producer

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth assumed oblate spheroid with size as determined by IAU in 1965 (major axis = 6 378 160.0 m, minor axis = 6 356 775.0 m, f = 1/297.0)

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth assumed oblate spheroid with major and minor axes specified (in km) by data producer

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth assumed oblate spheroid as defined in IAG-GRS80 model (major axis = 6 378 137.0 m, minor axis = 6 356 752.314 m, f = 1/298.257 222 101)

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth assumed represented by WGS-84 (as used by ICAO since 1998)

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth assumed spherical with radius of 6 371 229.0 m

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth assumed oblate spheroid with major or minor axes specified (in m) by data producer

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth model assumed spherical with radius of 6 371 200 m, but the horizontal datum of the resulting latitude/longitude field is the WGS-84 reference frame

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.2 - Shape of the Earth
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Earth represented by the Ordnance Survey Great Britain 1936 Datum, using the Airy 1830 Spheroid, the Greenwich meridian as 0 longitude, and the Newlyn datum as mean sea level, 0 height

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Flag table 3.4 - Scanning mode
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Rows have Ni grid points and columns have Nj grid points

Code table 3.11 - Interpretation of list of numbers at end of section 3
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Numbers define number of points corresponding to full coordinate circles (i.e. parallels), coordinate values on each circle are multiple of the circle mesh, and extreme coordinate values given in grid definition (i.e. extreme longitudes) may not be reached in all rows

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.11 - Interpretation of list of numbers at end of section 3
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Numbers define number of points corresponding to coordinate lines delimited by extreme coordinate values given in grid definition (i.e. extreme longitudes) which are present in each row

GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.Title_en: Code table 3.11 - Interpretation of list of numbers at end of section 3
GRIB2_20_0_0_CodeFlag_en.MeaningParameterDescription_en: Numbers define the actual latitudes for each row in the grid. The list of numbers are integer values of the valid latitudes in microdegrees (scaled by 10-6) or in unit equal to the ratio of the basic angle and the subdivisions number for each row, in the same order as specified in the "scanning mode flag" (bit no. 2)
